transition.description:
Page transition, powered by Vue's `<TransitionGroup/>`

Built-in transitions:
- fade
- fade-out
- slide-left
- slide-right
- slide-up
- slide-down

See https://sli.dev/guide/animations.html#pages-transitions

See https://vuejs.org/guide/built-ins/transition.html

layout.description:
Slide layout to use

Default to 'cover' for the first slide, 'default' for the rest
layout.markdownDescription:
Slide layout to use

Default to 'cover' for the first slide, 'default' for the rest

class.description: Custom class added to the slide root element
class.markdownDescription: Custom class added to the slide root element

clicks.description:
Manually specified the total clicks needed to this slide

When not specified, the clicks will be calculated by the usage of v-clicks

See https://sli.dev/guide/animations
clicks.markdownDescription:

clicksStart.description: Manually specified the total clicks needed to this slide to start
clicksStart.markdownDescription: Manually specified the total clicks needed to this slide to start

preload.description: Preload the slide when the previous slide is active
preload.markdownDescription: Preload the slide when the previous slide is active

hide.description: Completely hide and disable the slide
hide.markdownDescription: Completely hide and disable the slide

disabled.description: Same as `hide`, completely hide and disable the slide
disabled.markdownDescription: Same as `hide`, completely hide and disable the slide

hideInToc.description:
hide the slide for the `<Toc>` components

See https://sli.dev/builtin/components#toc

level.description: Override the title level for the <TitleRenderer> and <Toc> components Only if `title` has also been declared

routeAlias.description: Create a route alias that can be used in the URL or with the <Link> component
routeAlias.markdownDescription: Create a route alias that can be used in the URL or with the <Link> component

zoom.description: Custom zoom level for the slide
zoom.markdownDescription: Custom zoom level for the slide

dragPos.description:
Store the positions of draggable elements Normally you don't need to set this manually
